title: Untitled

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of brush and black ink on paper.

medium_display: Brush and black ink on paper
credit_line: Through prior gift of The Charles H. and Mary F.S. Worcester Collection
publication_history:
Brenda Richardson, Barnett Newman: The Complete Drawings, 1944-1969 (Baltimore: Baltimore Museum of Art, 1979), pp. 174-75, no. 68 (color ill.).

Richard Shiff, Carol C. Mancusi-Ungaro, and Heidi Colsman-Freyberger, Barnett Newman: A Catalogue Raisonne (The Barnett Newman Foundation and Yale University Press, 2004), p. 433, no. 186 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, Museum of Modern Art, “Barnett Newman,” Oct. 21, 1971–Jan. 10, 1972, cat. 114 (ill.); also Amsterdam, Stedelijk Museum, Mar. 30–May 22, 1972, cat. 84 (ill.); London, Tate Gallery, June 28–Aug. 6, 1972, cat. 83; and Paris, Grand Palais, Oct. 10–Dec. 11, 1972, pp. 127 and 132, cat. 83 (ill.).

Indianapolis Museum of Art, “Perceptions of the Spirit in Twentieth-Century American Art,” Sept. 20–Nov. 27, 1977, cat. 67; also Berkeley University Art Museum, Dec. 28, 1977–Feb. 12, 1978; San Antonio, Tex., Marion Koogler McKay Art Institute, Mar. 5–Apr. 16, 1978; and Columbus, Ohio, Gallery of Fine Art, May 10¬–June 18, 1978.

Baltimore Museum of Art, “Barnett Newman: The Complete Drawings, 1944–1969,” Apr. 22–June 17, 1979, pp. 174–75, cat. 68 (color ill.); also Detroit Institute of Arts, Aug. 7–Sept. 30, 1979; Chicago, Museum of Contemporary Art, Nov. 2, 1979–Jan. 6, 1980; New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Feb. 12–Apr. 9, 1980; Amsterdam, Stedelijk Museum, Sept.8–Oct. 19, 1980, cat. 58; and Paris, Musée National d’Art Moderne, Centre Georges Pompidou, Nov. 14, 1980–Jan. 4, 1981, cat. 64. 

Colgone, Museum Ludwig, “Barnett Newman: Das zeichnerische Werk,” Feb. 20–Mar. 29, 1981, cat. 63; also Basel, Kunstmuseum, May 9–July 5, 1981.

Cologne, Museum Ludwig, Rheinhallen, “Bilderstreit: Widerspruch, Einheit und Fragment in der Kunst seit 1960,” Apr. 8–June 28, 1989, cat. 515d.

Düsseldorf, Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen, “Barnett Newman: Bilder, Skulpturen, Graphik,” May 17–Aug. 10, 1997, cat. 28 (ill.).
provenance_text: By descent to the artist's wife, Annalee Newman (1909-2000); sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1990.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Barnett Newman Foundation / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
